contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=March 2007}}'''Ijuin Tada'aki'''(伊集院忠朗; 1520-1561) a retainer of the Japanese clan of [[Shimazu clan|Shimazu]] following the [[Sengoku period]] of the 16th century of Japan. Under Tada'aki, [[Ijuin clan]] would rise to the prominence as one of the most important retainer in the [[Shimazu clan]]. He served under [[Shimazu Tadayoshi]] and [[Shimazu Takahisa]] was essential in uniting [[Shimazu clan]], and battles against [[Ito clan]] and [[Kimotsuki clan]]. At the [[siege of Iwatsurugi]] in 1554, it was recorded that Tada'aki had his troop use matchlock guns against enemies for the first time by the [[Shimazu clan|Shimazu]] army. For this and other contributions and services, he held the post of the top [[karo]] until 1556 and governed as the top official of the clan. It is recorded that on 1561 while having a party with [[Kimotsuki Kanetsugu]], Tada'aki offended Kanetsugu so well that humiliated Kanetsugu started a war that the [[Shimazu clan]] wanted all along. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ijuin, Tadaaki | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Samurai | DATE OF BIRTH = 1520 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1561 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ijuin, Tadaaki}} [[Category:1520 births]] [[Category:1561 deaths]] [[Category:Samurai]]
